s.text: The proteins were denatured by boiling for 5 min, then were separated by electrophoresis on 7.5% SDS-PAGE, and transferred to PVDF membranes.
Direct inhibition of PI-3Kinase activity may not be feasible either as it is likely to have severe side effects.
The presence of the inhibitory antibody reduced the number of colonies growing in soft agar but the control antibody had no effect (Table 1).

Transformation appears to involve autocrine stimulation as IGF-I production and secretion is increased in normal cells following transformation by SV40 T antigen, but the null cells cannot respond to the IGF-I so do not transform.
To test the function of the virally encoded receptors, we measured IGF-I stimulated autophosphorylation of the IGF-IR and phosphorylation of IRS-1.
The transfected receptors are expressed at four fold the level of the endogenous receptors.
Thus, the retrovirus allows 20 to 30-fold overexpression of the transfected receptor.
The transfected receptors are expressed at four fold the level of the endogenous receptors.
The transfected receptors are expressed at four fold the level of the endogenous receptors.
The transfected receptors are expressed at four fold the level of the endogenous receptors.

Signaling by the IGF-IR has been studied in many different cell types and is important for proliferation, survival, motility, adhesion, transformation, tumor formation and metastasis [for reviews see refs [ 31 32 ] ]. The receptor can directly phosphorylate the insulin receptor substrate 1 (IRS-1) and Shc proteins in the intact cell causing activation of PI-3Kinase and ras signaling [ 33 ] . More recently, it has been shown that the IGF-IR signals via the G?? subunits of the heterotrimeric Gi complex to stimulate PI-3Kinase and ras, and also activates the JAK/Stat pathway to cause phosphorylation of Stat3 [ 34 35 ] .
